DataElement.preferredName: Anticoagulant Agent Requirement Drug Interaction Avoidance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to the requirements of anticoagulation agents in order to avoid drug interactions as outlined in  the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anticoagulant Agent Requirement Drug Interaction Avoidance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Alteration of the disposition and/or effect of a drug, owing to the presence of another factor such as a second drug, or food._A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: Alteration of the disposition and/or effect of a drug, owing to the presence of another factor such as a second drug, or food.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient requires anticoagu
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient requires anticoagulation while on protocol, have they been switched from warfarin to another alternative anticoagulant such as low molecular weight heparin or oral direct factor Xa inhibitors as deemed appropriate by the treating physician for the duration they are on capecitabine (must be switched at least 1 week prior to starting capecitabine) to avoid drug-drug interaction of warfarin with capecitabine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on anticoagulation therapy, there is no anticipated drug-drug interactions (DDI) between the anticoagulation agent and TAK-243 OR patient will be transitioned to a TAK-243-compatible anticoagulation agent?
